result.execSummary:
The defendant Darold R. Crass was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

w/huber - concurrent to Portage County Sentence 14CM365 - Court not opposed to serving the sentence in Portage County Jail.
Concurrent with: Portage County case 14CM364

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Darold R. Crass in court by  phone in custody in Portage County jail with attorney Alec Nocco for Gavin Grubofski.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given.  No victim rights.  Court to give sentencing

Court orders:
45 days jail w/huber concurrent with Portage County Sentence 14CM364 - Court not opposed to serving the sentence in the Portage County Jail
Court Costs and any applicable assessments, fees and surcharges due the court.

7 days sentence credit

Defendant Darold R. Crass in court(by Attorney Gavin Grubofski) with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called appearances given by the State.  Defense attorney addresses the court regarding the non appearance of Deft.  Problems with the Portage County Jail.  If able to appear later today we will try to take care of later.

Defendant Darold R. Crass in court with attorney Gavin Grubofski.  Kurt Byron Zengler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deft enters a plea of guilty   Plea questionnaire reviewed. Clerk directed to enter plea. Factual basis. Court accepts pleas & finds guilty.

Court orders: defense would like to do the sentencing at a later time.  Until after the sentencing in Portage county (9/4/15)  
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 4, 2015 at 11:15 am.
